intro: Sanvitalia ocymoides, commonly known as the Mexican firecracker, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its striking appearance and easy care requirements make it a desirable ornamental plant.
